intro: Astephania, commonly known as the silver vine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and striking silver-green leaves. The plant produces small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Astephania is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments. It is also used in traditional medicine in some regions for its purported health benefits.
